Posts.EditableText: Do you think a Who Wants to be a Millionaire clone would stand a chance?
Posts.HTML: Do you think a Who Wants to be a Millionaire clone would stand a chance?

Posts.EditableText: It'd be in with a good chance of last place if that's what you're asking. Actually, you might not even be allowed to enter a game like that. I haven't glanced at the rules recently but I'm sure there's something in them about games being original works, i.e. not copied off a quiz show.

Posts.EditableText: Thanks, i'll go and search around for the rules.  It was just my first game I'm developing and some feedback would be great.  Unfortunately development is coming along slowly, so it might be a while before you see the game in games list.

Posts.EditableText: I've just been to the IF Comp website and had a bit of a read of the rules.  I can't enter my Millionaire game due to a copyright rule unfortunately.  But that's not going to stop me finishing it and posting it on this website.  I'll try and release a test version that goes up to 32,000 dollars soon so that users can try it out and give me feedback.

Posts.EditableText: What is the website and when is the closing date?
Posts.HTML: What is the website and when is the closing date?

Posts.EditableText:
[url:2db3mh3o]http://www.ifcomp.org/[/url:2db3mh3o]

Authors have to announce their intent to enter by the 1st September and games are uploaded by the 30th September. So a while yet if you plan to enter.
